name: hadoop.security.groups.cache.secs
description:
This is the config controlling the validity of the entries in the cache
    containing the user->group mapping. When this duration has expired,
    then the implementation of the group mapping provider is invoked to get
    the groups of the user and then cached back.

name: dfs.namenode.blockreport.max.lock.hold.time
description: The BlockReportProcessingThread max write lock hold time in ms.

name: dfs.namenode.decommission.blocks.per.interval
description:
The approximate number of blocks to process per decommission
    or maintenance interval, as defined in dfs.namenode.decommission.interval.

name: mapreduce.reduce.shuffle.retry-delay.max.ms
description:
The maximum number of ms the reducer will delay before retrying
  to download map data.

name: ipc.[port_number].weighted-cost.handler
description:
The weight multiplier to apply to the time spent in the
    HANDLER phase which do not involve holding a lock.
    See org.apache.hadoop.ipc.ProcessingDetails.Timing for more details on
    this phase. This property applies to WeightedTimeCostProvider.

name: ha.failover-controller.graceful-fence.connection.retries
description: FC connection retries for graceful fencing

name: yarn.app.mapreduce.am.container.log.backups
description:
Number of backup files for the ApplicationMaster logs when using
    ContainerRollingLogAppender (CRLA). See
    org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender.maxBackupIndex. By default,
    ContainerLogAppender (CLA) is used, and container logs are not rolled. CRLA
    is enabled for the ApplicationMaster when both
    yarn.app.mapreduce.am.container.log.limit.kb and
    yarn.app.mapreduce.am.container.log.backups are greater than zero.

name: dfs.blockreport.split.threshold
description:
If the number of blocks on the DataNode is below this
    threshold then it will send block reports for all Storage Directories
    in a single message.

    If the number of blocks exceeds this threshold then the DataNode will
    send block reports for each Storage Directory in separate messages.

    Set to zero to always split.

name: dfs.datanode.handler.count
description: The number of server threads for the datanode.
